page.title: 03Religion around Kilby
page.content: The block contains only three churches each an Anglican Parish Church. One of them is situated in Kilby itself another St Lukes is in Newton Harcourt (of which only the church really comes into our block) the third,and most interesting is St Wistans in Wistow Park. This church once served the village of Wistow,now disappeared. The village was named after Wistan Prince of Mercia who was murdered on this site. Blood is still supposed to spurt from the spot on the anniversary of his death.Of the three perhaps the Kilby church is the most important since along vith its church hall it is still a centre of village life.
